utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Hey gorgeous, how's it going?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Dehydrated Japanese noodles under fluorescent lights... does it get better than this?

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Question. You're not dating anybody, are you, because I met somebody who would be perfect for you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah, y'see, perfect might be a problem. Had you said 'co-dependent', or 'self-destructive'...

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Do you want a date Saturday?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes please.

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Okay. He's cute, he's funny, he's-

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He's a he?

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Well yeah! ...Oh God. I- just- I thought- Good, Shelley. I'm just gonna go flush myself down the toilet now... Okay, goodbye...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...Couldn't enjoy a cup of noodles after that. I mean, is that ridiculous? Can you believe she actually thought that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um... yeah. Well, I mean, when I first met you, y'know, I thought maybe, possibly, you might be...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You did?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, but then you spent Phoebe's entire birthday party talking to my breasts, so then I figured maybe not.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Huh. Did, uh... any of the rest of you guys think that when you first met me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I think so, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Not me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nono, me neither. Although, uh, y'know, back in college, Susan Sallidor did.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You're kidding! Did you tell her I wasn't?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No. No, it's just 'cause, uh, I kinda wanted to go out with her too, so I told her, actually, you were seeing Bernie Spellman... who also liked her, so...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, this is fascinating. So, uh, what is it about me?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I dunno, 'cause you're smart, you're funny...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross is smart and funny, d'you ever think that about him?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah! Right!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: WHAT IS IT?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I-I d'know, you-you just- you have a quality.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yes. Absolutely. A quality.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, oh, a quality, good, because I was worried you guys were gonna be vague about this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello? Hello? Oh! Rachel, it's Paolo calling from Rome.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Calling from Rome! Bon giorno, caro mio.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So he's calling from Rome. I could do that. Just gotta go to Rome.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica, your dad just beeped in, but can you make it quick? Talking to Rome. I'm talking to Rome.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey dad, what's up? Oh God. Ross, it's Nana.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, uh, how's she doing?

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lillian
utterance.content: The doctor says it's a matter of hours.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How-how are you, Mom?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Me? I'm fine, fine. I'm glad you're here. ...What's with your hair?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: What's different?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh, maybe that's it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She is unbelievable, our mother is...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, relax, relax. We are gonna be here for a while, it looks like, and we still have boyfriends and your career to cover.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The fuzzy little mints at the bottom of her purse.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! ...Yeah, they were gross. Oh, you know what I loved? Her Sweet 'n' Los. How she was always stealing them from- from restaurants.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Not just restaurants, from our house.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Mrs. Geller?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She looks so small.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, at least she's with Pop-Pop and Aunt Phyllis now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: G'bye, Nana.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Bye, Nana.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: What is going on?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y'know how-how the nurse said that-that Nana had passed? Well, she's not, quite..

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She's not- past, she's present, she's back.

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lillian
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: She may have died.

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lillian
utterance.content: She may have died?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: We're looking into it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I, uh, I'll go see.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: This almost never happens!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Now she's passed.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I just have to know, okay. Is it my hair?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, Chandler, that's exactly what it is. It's your hair.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, you have homosexual hair.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, um, did she...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Twice.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Twice?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, that sucks!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You guys okay?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I dunno, it's weird. I mean, I know she's gone, but I just don't feel, uh...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Maybe that's 'cause she's not really gone.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nono, she's gone.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We checked. A lot.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hm, I mean maybe no-one ever really goes. Ever since my mom died, every now and then, I get the feeling that she's like right here, y'know? Oh! And Debbie, my best friend from junior high- got struck by lightning on a miniature golf course- I always get this really strong Debbie vibe whenever I use one of those little yellow pencils, y'know? ...I miss her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Aw. Hey, Pheebs, want this?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sure. I just sharpened her this morning.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Now, see, I don't believe any of that. I think once you're dead, you're dead! You're gone! You're worm food! ...So Chandler looks gay, huh?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y'know, I dunno who this is, but it's not Debbie.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I thought it was gonna be a closed casket.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Well, that doesn't mean she can't look nice!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Sweetie, you think you can get in there?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't see why not.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here's my retainer!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I was just thinking. When my time comes-

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Dad!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Listen to me! When my time comes, I wanna be buried at sea.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You what?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I wanna be buried at sea, it looks like fun.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Define fun.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: C'mon, you'll make a day of it! You'll rent a boat, pack a lunch...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ...And then we throw your body in the water... Gee, that does sound fun.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Everyone thinks they know me. Everyone says 'Jack Geller, so predictable'. Maybe after I'm gone, they'll say 'Buried at sea! Huh!'.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's probably what they'll say.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I'd like that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Hey. Look, I'm sorry about yesterday, I, um-

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, nono, don't- don't worry about it. Believe me, apparently other people have made the same mistake.

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Oh! Okay! Phew!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, uh... what do you think it is about me?

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: I dunno, uh... you just have a-a...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...Quality, right, great.

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Y'know, it's a shame, because you and Lowell would've made a great couple.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Lowell? Financial Services' Lowell, that's who you saw me with?

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: What? He's cute!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, yeah... 's'no Brian in Payroll.

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Is Brian...?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! Uh, I d'know! The point is, if you were gonna set me up with someone, I'd like to think you'd set me up with someone like him.

utterance.speaker: Shelley
utterance.content: Well, I think Brian's a little out of your league.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Excuse me? You don't think I could get a Brian? Because I could get a Brian. Believe you me. ...I'm really not.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This one?

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lillian
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I have shown you everything we have. Unless you want your mother to spend eternity in a lemon yellow pant-suit, go with the burgundy.

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lillian
utterance.content: You know, whatever we pick, she would've told us it's the wrong one.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: You're right. We'll go with the burgundy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! A fine choice. I'm coming out.

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lillian
utterance.content: Wait! We need shoes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. Um, how about these?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: That's really a day shoe.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And where she's going everyone else'll be dressier?

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lillian
utterance.content: Could we see something in a slimmer heel?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I have nothing in an evening shoe in the burgundy. I can show you something in a silver that may work.

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lillian
utterance.content: No, it really should be burgundy.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Mm. Unless we go with a different dress?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! Nonono, wait a sec. I may have something in the back.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God..

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Is everything all right, dear?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, just... just Nana stuff.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How we doing, you guys ready?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Mom already called this morning to remind me not to wear my hair up. Did you know my ears are not my best feature?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Some days it's all I can think about.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi, sorry I'm late, I couldn't find my bearings.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you-you mean your earrings?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What'd I say?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hm-m.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are these the shoes?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes. Paolo sent them from Italy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, we-uh- we don't have shoes here, or...?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Morning. We ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, don't we look nice all dressed up?...It's stuff like that, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It was a really beautiful service.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: It really was. Oh, c'mere, sweetheart. Y'know, I think it might be time for you to start using night cream.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nothing, just your overcoat sounds remarkably like Brent Mussberger.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Check it out, Giants-Cowboys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You're watching a football game at a funeral?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, it's the pre-game. I'm gonna watch it at the reception.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You are a frightening, frightening man.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no! My new Paolo shoes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I hope they're not ruined.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: God, what a great day. ...What? Weather-wise!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know, uh, the air, the-the trees... even though Nana's gone there's, there's something almost, uh- I dunno, almost life-aff-

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: God! Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm fine. Just-just... having my worst fear realised...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, don't worry, I'm just checking to see if the muscle's in spasm...huh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, what is it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You missed a belt loop.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! No-n-

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, it's in spasm.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Here, sweetie, here. I took these when I had my golfing accident.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, no-

utterance.speaker: Andrea
utterance.content: Sorry- Hi, I'm Dorothy's daughter.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi, I'm Chandler, and I have no idea who Dorothy is.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, look who's up! How do you feel?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I feel great. I feel- great, I fleel great.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow, those pills really worked, huh?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not the first two, but the second two- woooo! ...I love you guys. You guys are the greatest. I love my sister , I love Pheebs...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh! That's so nice...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And listen, man, if you wanna be gay, be gay. Doesn't matter to me.

utterance.speaker: Andrea
utterance.content: You were right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rachel. Rachel Rachel. I love you the most.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well you know who I love the most?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh.. you don't get it!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Whaddya got there?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just a, uh... hearing disability.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: What's the score?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Seventeen-fourteen Giants... three minutes to go in the third.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Beautiful!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs, could you maybe hand me a cracker?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Your grandmother would have hated this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, sure, what with it being her funeral and all.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: No, I'd be hearing about 'Why didn't I get the honey-glazed ham?', I didn't spend enough on flowers, and if I spent more she'd be saying 'Why are you wasting your money? I don't need flowers, I'm dead'.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That sounds like Nana.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Do you know what it's like to grow up with someone who is critical of every single thing you say?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ...I can imagine.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I'm telling you, it's a wonder your mother turned out to be the positive, life-affirming person that she is.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That is a wonder. So tell me something, Mom. If you had to do it all over again, I mean, if she was here right now, would you tell her?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Tell her what?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How she drove you crazy, picking on every little detail, like your hair... for example.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I'm not sure I know what you're getting at.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you think things would have been better if you'd just told her the truth?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: ...No. I think some things are better left unsaid. I think it's nicer when people just get along.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: More wine, dear?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I think so.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Those earrings look really lovely on you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you. They're yours.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Actually they were Nana's.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Now I'm depressed! ... Even more than I was.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, who's this little naked guy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That little naked guy would be me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Aww, look at the little thing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, yes, fine, that is my penis. Can we be grown-ups now?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Who are those people?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Got me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, that's Nana, right there in the middle. 'Me and the gang at Java Joe's'.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow, Monica, you look just like your grandmother. How old was she there?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Let's see, 1939... yeah, 24, 25?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Looks like a fun gang.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh, look-look-look-look-look! I got Monica naked!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nono, that would be me again. I'm, uh, just trying something.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, Lowell.

utterance.speaker: Lowell
utterance.content: Hey, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So how's it going there in Financial Services?

utterance.speaker: Lowell
utterance.content: It's like Mardi Gras without the paper mache heads. How 'bout you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Good, good. Listen, heh, I dunno what Shelley told you about me, but, uh... I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Lowell
utterance.content: I know. That's what I told her.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: Lowell
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So- you can tell?

utterance.speaker: Lowell
utterance.content: Pretty much, most of the time. We have a kind of... radar.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So you don't think I have a, a quality?

utterance.speaker: Lowell
utterance.content: Speaking for my people, I'd have to say no. By the way, your friend Brian from Payroll, he is.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He is?

utterance.speaker: Lowell
utterance.content: Yup, and waaay out of your league.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Out of my league. I could get a Brian. If I wanted to get a Brian, I could get a Brian. Hey, Brian.
